content: marin hat by kimberly k mcalindin kimberly k mcalindin ©2019 please do not reproduce or sell the pattern or sell items that are knitted from this pattern instagram kimberlymcalindin facebook hooked on knitting questions kimberlymcalindin@gmail com special thank you to my daughter and model marin 💚 marin hat the marin hat is a quick knit that can be worn either as a traditional hat with a folded brim or leave the brim unfolded for a slouchy look made in loopy mango merino worsted yarn it is soft and light and oh so warm needles suggested size us 6 4 mm in 16 40 cm us 8 5 mm in 16 40 cm and a set of double pointed needles gauge 17sts and 32rows over 4 10 cm please take time to block your swatch to ensure you have enough yarn for your project materials yarn loopy mango merino wool 109 yards 100 m 50grams color used polar bear notions stitch markers darning needle fur pom pom yardage yardage is estimated and may vary depending on yarn used fiber content of yarn and any modifications to the original pattern such as texture work or lace mc 160 yards 146 meters size one size the hat is stretchy and will fit most adult sized heads directions with smaller needles cast on 88 being careful not to twist place marker and join to work in the round round 1 k2 p2 repeat around work round 1 until ribbing measures 2 5 6 35 cm switch to larger needles round 1 * k2 p1 k1 p1 k1 p2 repeat from * around round 2 * k2 p2 k1 p1 k1 p1 repeat from * around repeat rounds 1 & 2 until hat measures 9 22 86 cm from cast on edge ending with round 2 crown shaping note change to double pointed needles when necessary in this round you will move the beginning of round marker move the marker so that it sits between the first 2 knit sts round 1 *ssk k1 p1 k1 p1 k2tog repeat from * around round 2 k1 *p1 k1 p1 k1 k2 repeat from * around round 3 *ssk p1 k1 k2tog repeat from * around round 4 k2 p1 *k3 p1 repeat from * around ending with k1 round 5 *ssk k2tog repeat from * around round 6 k round 7 k2tog around round 8 k round 9 k2tog around ending with k1 break yarn leaving a 6 to 8 inch tail use your darning needle to draw the yarn through remaining stitches pull gently the yarn is delicate to close weave in ends sew pom pom to top
